translations.text: A spring morning at the school gate, cherry blossom petals dancing in the wind.
"Um, excuse me!"
When I turned around, an unfamiliar girl stood there, out of breath.
"What's wrong?"
"Oh, nice to meet you! I'm Misaki Tanaka, a transfer student. *My heart's pounding*
"I can't find my classroom..."
"Ah, I see. Sure, I'll show you the way."
"Really? Thank you so much!"
Her smile was dazzling. The spring morning suddenly brightened.
"Hey, Kenta!"
I heard my best friend's voice from behind.
"What are you doing this early in the morning? We're going to be late."
"I'm showing the transfer student around."
"Oh, nice to meet you! I'm Taro Yamada."
"Nice to meet you, Yamada-senpai!"
"I'm not a senpai, we're classmates! Gahaha!"
Lunch break. Spreading out my bento on the rooftop bench.
"Is that a homemade bento? That's amazing!"
"Yeah. I live alone, so."
"I live alone too. But I'm not good at cooking..."
"Really? If you'd like, I could teach you?"
"Really!? I'd be so happy!"
Suddenly, a bell rang in the distance. *Gong, gong.*
"Oh? Misaki-chan, what are you doing about clubs?"
"I haven't decided yet... I'd like to check out various clubs."
"Then come watch our soccer club!"
"Misaki-san, there you are."
An elegant voice echoed. When I turned around, I saw the student council president.
"I'm Yukino Hashimoto, the student council president. I wanted to introduce the student council to our transfer student."
"Do you have a moment?"
What should I do...
"Misaki, if you're interested, you should go check it out."
"Yes! Please, Hashimoto-senpai."
"Then, please come to the student council room."
The student council room was quiet and orderly. *Total silence.*
"The student council plans and manages school events."
"The responsibility is heavy, but it's rewarding work."
"It sounds wonderful... but can I really do this?"
"You'll be fine. Let's work hard together."
Her smile was as warm as the spring sunshine.
"Yes, please take care of me!"
And so, Misaki's new school life began.
"I'm sorry, I have plans today..."
"I see, that's too bad. Maybe next time then!"
"Well then, excuse me."
Yukino gracefully departed.
"Want to go watch the soccer club practice?"
"Yes! I'm looking forward to it!"
On the field, the players were working up a sweat.
"Alright, let's give it our all today!"
The sound of kicking the ball echoed. *Thwack, thwack.*
"Everyone looks so cool..."
"Taro really loves soccer."
"I want to find something I can be passionate about too."
"I'm sure you'll find it. There's no need to rush."
The setting sun illuminated the two of them.
"Thank you, Sato-senpai."
And so, Misaki's new school life began.
